snippet: A plan aims to prevent backsliding by Syria’s government and limit the time that international experts need to work in the country.
abstract: Plan to dismantle Syria's chemical weapons program will include Field Deployable Hydrolysis System, highly sophisticated mobile system developed by Pentagon that will convert large quantities of chemical agents into compounds that cannot be used for military purposes.

byline.contributor: Anne Barnard contributed reporting from Damascus, Syria.

lead_paragraph: A plan aims to prevent backsliding by Syria’s government and limit the time that international experts need to work in the country.

headline.main: Plan for Ridding Syria of Chemical Arms Includes Brute Force and Chemistry
headline.print_headline: Plan for Ridding Syria of Chemical Arms Includes Brute Force and Chemistry
